title: Maritime Area Planning Act 2021 (No. 50 of 2021), after consultation with the
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Maritime Area Usage (Licence
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Maritime Area Usage (Licence 

Fees) Regulations 2023. 

Definition

title: Maritime Area Planning Act 2021 (No. 50 of 2021), after consultation with the
heading: 3. The fee specified to accompany an application under the Act for—
text_raw:
3. The fee specified to accompany an application under the Act for— 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

a declaration under section 115(1), is €500, 

the grant of a licence referred to in section 117(1), is €1,000, 
together with a refundable amount of €1,000 in case appropriate 
 assessment is not carried out under section 117(6)(a), 

the assignment of a licence under section 124(2), is €500, 

the material amendment of a licence under section 125(1), is 
€1,000, and 

(d) 

the surrender of a licence under section 126(1), is €500. 

Exemptions, refunds and waivers
text_norm: 3 fee specified accompany application act for-- (a) (b) (c) (d) declaration section 115(1) eur500 grant licence referred section 117(1) eur1 000 together refundable amount eur1 000 case appropriate assessment carried section 117(6)(a) assignment licence section 124(2) eur500 material amendment licence section 125(1) eur1 000 (d) surrender licence section 126(1) eur500 exemption refund waiver

title: Maritime Area Planning Act 2021 (No. 50 of 2021), after consultation with the
heading: 4. (1) Where appropriate assessment is not required to be carried out as
text_raw:
4. (1) Where appropriate assessment is not required to be carried out as 
referred to in paragraph (b) of Regulation 3 the refundable amount referred to in 
that paragraph shall be refunded to the applicant. 

(2) The MARA may waive a fee under these Regulations where the applicant 
is a non-profit entity being a legal person organised for a collective, public or 
social benefit and does not operate as a business whose aim is to generate a profit 
for its owners. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

14 August, 2023. 

DARRAGH O’BRIEN, 

Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 18th August, 2023.

title: Maritime Area Planning Act 2021 (No. 50 of 2021), after consultation with the
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide for fees to accompany certain applications in relation 
to licences authorising certain maritime usage in the maritime area of the State. 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [402]
